description: All files must follow templates based on their folder location or file name. Templates provide consistent structure and ensure proper organization. This is a bot_builder rule - ALL bots created using bot_builder must follow these template conventions.

examples.description: All bots created must follow bot_builder templates
examples.content: Every bot created using bot_builder (agile_bot/bots/{bot_name}/) must follow bot_builder template structure for agent.json and all configuration files

examples.description: Files in bots folder follow bot_builder template
Files in projects folder follow active bot templates
examples.content: Projects use templates from the bot that is active on the project (e.g., story_bot templates for story projects)
instructions.json files follow instructions.json template, .json files in rules/ folder follow rules.json template
Files in templates/ folder define the template structure for files with matching names in other locations

examples.description: Reference templates instead of duplicating structure
examples.content: Load template from template file path, do NOT repeat template structure in prompts or instructions

examples.description: Don't create bots without following bot_builder template rules
examples.content: Creating a new bot without following bot_builder template conventions violates this rule - ALL bots must follow these rules

examples.description: Don't create files without following appropriate template
examples.content: Creating agent.json without following bot_builder template structure

examples.description: Don't duplicate template structure in code or prompts
examples.content: Repeating template structure in instructions instead of referencing template file

examples.description: Don't use mismatched templates for folder locations
examples.content: Using story_bot templates for domain_bot files, or vice versa
